body_html:
Variegated Liriope refers to cultivars of Liriope muscari, commonly known as lilyturf or monkey grass, that display variegation in their foliage. Variegation refers to the presence of different colors, often in the form of stripes or patterns, on the leaves. Here are some key features of variegated liriope:

  1. Foliage: Variegated liriope cultivars have leaves that exhibit a mix of colors, typically including shades of green along with lighter colors, such as cream or yellow. The variegation can take various patterns, such as stripes or margins.

  2. Height: Like other liriope varieties, variegated liriope is generally a low-growing plant, forming clumps that reach a height of about 12 to 18 inches.

  3. Flowers: In late summer to early fall, liriope produces spikes of small, lavender to violet-purple flowers. The flowers add a vertical element to the plant.

  4. Versatility: Variegated liriope is often used for its ornamental value in landscaping. It can be employed as ground cover, edging, or as an accent plant in gardens.

  5. Shade Tolerance: Liriope, including variegated cultivars, is well-known for its ability to thrive in partial to full shade conditions. This makes it a suitable choice for shaded areas where other plants might struggle.

  6. Drought Tolerance: Once established, variegated liriope is relatively drought-tolerant, requiring less water than some other ornamental plants.

  7. Hardiness: Liriope, in general, is hardy in a variety of climates. Variegated cultivars should be well-suited to the same regions as their non-variegated counterparts.

When incorporating variegated liriope into your garden, consider its growing conditions, such as soil type and sunlight requirements, to ensure optimal performance. As with any plant, local climate and soil conditions should be taken into account for the best results.

body_html:
The delicate, pink-to-red blooms of Autumn Fire Sedum are sure to delight your landscape this season. This sedum adds softness and texture to any space, attracting both butterflies and hummingbirds to its pink flowers. A wonderful addition as a border or in mixed plantings, here's why Autumn Fire Sedum is perfect for your garden:

Appearance: This variety produces small clusters of pink flowers on upright, fleshy foliage. Its compact size makes Autumn Fire Sedum a great choice for smaller landscapes, with a height of 24-30 inches and a spread of 18-24 inches. This sedum would also do well in container plantings.

Blooming Season: Autumn Fire Sedum blooms dusty pink in the late summer to early fall. The blooms will gradually darken to a brick red through the autumn season, providing a spectacular display of pink-to-red hues. Seed heads left untouched post-flowering season provide winter interest and food for birds. 

Sun and Soil Requirements: This sedum prefers full sun to partial sun, and is an extremely heat tolerant variety. Average watering is preferred in well draining soil. However, Autumn Fire Sedum can tolerate slightly heavier soils. 

Landscape Use: Autumn Fire Sedum is a great choice for landscape beds, borders, and containers. The post-bloom seed heads attract birds to your garden, enhancing biodiversity and ecosystem health. Create a haven while enjoying the beauty of this beloved garden favorite.
title: Sedum Autumn Fire 1 Gallon

body_html:
Daddy Pete's Planting Mix helps to enhance soils back to life. This organic mix consists of Daddy Pete's Composted Cow Manure and aged pine bark fines. The aged pine bark fines provide air space, while the composted cow manure will help retain moisture and add natural nutrition to your soils. This blend works best when mixed with your existing soil to plant shurbs and trees. Mix 50% of Daddy Pete's Planting Mix with 50% of your exisiting soil to create a nutritional growing medium. Bage Size: 2 cubic ft.

Ingredients:

  • Daddy Pete's Composted Cow Manure
  • Premium Aged Pine Bark Fines

  5. Shade Tolerance: Liriope, including variegated cultivars, is well-known for its ability to thrive in partial to full shade conditions. This makes it a suitable choice for shaded areas where other plants might struggle.

  6. Drought Tolerance: Once established, variegated liriope is relatively drought-tolerant, requiring less water than some other ornamental plants.

  7. Hardiness: Liriope, in general, is hardy in a variety of climates. Variegated cultivars should be well-suited to the same regions as their non-variegated counterparts.

When incorporating variegated liriope into your garden, consider its growing conditions, such as soil type and sunlight requirements, to ensure optimal performance. As with any plant, local climate and soil conditions should be taken into account for the best results.

Plant Perennial Wallflower Bowles Me Away, or Erysimum linifolium ‘Bowles Me Away’, to add a delicate touch of purple to your landscape. Here’s why Wallflower ‘Bowles Me Away’ is the perfect addition to your garden:

Appearance: This evergreen variety features smooth, green foliage that stays low to the ground and showcases purple blooms during the spring and summer seasons. Wallflower Bowles Me Away grows well in a variety of landscapes, adding a graceful presence to any space it finds itself in. 

Size: Wallflower Bowles Me Away is multi–stemmed and spreads along the ground before turning upwards. These plants stay relatively low and compact, only reaching 12-24 inches high and wide. It is well-suited for use in borders, sloped areas, and containers.

Blooming Season: Shades of lilac and lavender purple blooms appear in late spring and continue through the summer months. Flowers appear in delicate clusters, attracting both hummingbirds and butterflies.

Sun and Soil Requirements: Wallflower Bowles Me Away prefers full shade to partial sun. Average watering is required and well-drained soil is ideal. However, they can withstand occasional periods of dryness. This variety of Wallflower thrives in zones 6-8.

Maintenance: Wallflower Bowles Me Away are relatively low-maintenance plants. Its tolerance to heat ensures continuous blooms from spring into the summer months. 

Landscape Use: The low, spreading nature of these plants make them a great choice for challenging landscape areas such as slopes and rock walls. Plant Wallflower Bowles Me Away for a colorful border or filler in garden beds. They are an excellent choice to embellish shaded areas in the ground or in a container on a porch, patio, etc.

Overall, Wallflower Bowles Me Away are valued for their attractive blooms, long bloom time, and low maintenance requirements. They are a wonderful choice to add a pop of color and pair well with other shade-loving plants.
title: Perennial Wallflower Bowles Me Away 1G

Cotoneaster 'Scarlet Leader' (Scarlet Leader Cotoneaster)

Cotoneaster 'Scarlet Leader', commonly known as Scarlet Leader Cotoneaster, is a versatile and attractive ground cover plant prized for its dense, spreading habit and vibrant foliage. Here's an overview of this delightful cultivar:

  • Dense Ground Cover: 'Scarlet Leader' forms a dense mat of foliage, making it an excellent choice for ground cover in various landscape settings. It quickly spreads to fill in empty spaces, providing effective weed suppression and erosion control. Plant 5 feet apart on center using Daddy Petes Planting Mix and Expoma Bio-Tone Starter Plus plant food.

  • Vibrant Foliage: One of the most striking features of 'Scarlet Leader' is its vibrant foliage. The glossy, dark green leaves create a lush carpet of color throughout the growing season, serving as an attractive backdrop for the landscape.

  • Seasonal Interest: In spring, 'Scarlet Leader' bursts into bloom with delicate clusters of small, white flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Following the flowers, bright red berries develop in late summer to fall, adding a splash of color and providing food for birds.

  • Drought Tolerance: Once established, 'Scarlet Leader' is remarkably drought tolerant, making it an ideal choice for low-maintenance landscapes and water-wise gardening. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and adapts well to a variety of soil types, including poor and rocky soils.

  • Versatile Use: Whether used as a ground cover beneath trees and shrubs, along slopes or embankments, or as a filler in flower beds and borders, 'Scarlet Leader' adds beauty and functionality to any landscape design. It can also be planted in containers or hanging baskets for a cascading effect.

  • Easy Care: With its low-maintenance nature and resilience to pests and diseases, 'Scarlet Leader' is a hassle-free plant that requires minimal upkeep. Occasional pruning to shape and control growth may be necessary, but otherwise, it thrives with little intervention.

  • Attractive to Wildlife: The berries produced by 'Scarlet Leader' are a valuable food source for birds, adding ecological value to the garden and attracting wildlife. Additionally, the dense foliage provides shelter and nesting sites for small animals and birds.

  • Winter Interest: Even in winter, 'Scarlet Leader' retains its appeal, with evergreen foliage that adds texture and color to the winter landscape. The persistent berries also provide visual interest and a pop of color against the backdrop of snow.

Whether used to cover large expanses of ground or to add visual interest to smaller garden spaces, Cotoneaster 'Scarlet Leader' is a versatile and beautiful ground cover plant that enhances the beauty and functionality of any landscape. With its vibrant foliage, seasonal blooms, and wildlife-friendly berries, it is sure to be a standout feature in gardens of all sizes.
title: Scarlet Leader' Cotoneaster

The "Silverfrost" Butterfly Bush (Buddleja davidii 'Silverfrost') is a popular cultivar known for its white flower spikes. Here are some key features and care tips for the Silverfrost Butterfly Bush:

  1. Flower Color: The most distinctive feature of Silverfrost is its white flower spikes. The color makes a striking contrast in the garden.

  2. Size: Butterfly bushes are generally fast-growing and can reach a height of around 6 to 8 feet, with a similar spread. They have an upright, arching growth habit.

  3. Flowering Period: Butterfly bushes are renowned for their long panicles of flowers, and Silverfrost is no exception. The bloom period typically occurs from midsummer into fall, attracting butterflies and other pollinators.

  4. Sunlight Requirements: Like most butterfly bushes, Silverfrost prefers full sun. Providing ample sunlight helps ensure vigorous growth and abundant flowering.

  5. Soil Conditions: Well-draining soil is crucial for butterfly bushes. They are adaptable to various soil types but thrive in moderately fertile soil.

  6. Watering: While established butterfly bushes are relatively drought-tolerant, regular watering during dry spells promotes healthier growth and flowering. Ensure the soil does not become overly dry.

  7. Pruning: Regular pruning is beneficial to maintain a more compact and bushy shape. Pruning is often done in late winter or early spring, removing dead or weak wood and shaping the plant.

  8. Fragrance: Butterfly bushes are known for their sweet fragrance, which adds to their appeal in the garden. The scent of Silverfrost's flowers can be quite pleasant.

  9. Wildlife Attraction: In addition to attracting butterflies, butterfly bushes can also attract hummingbirds and other pollinators.

Proper care, including regular watering, pruning, and providing adequate sunlight, will contribute to the health and beauty of this popular cultivar.
title: Silverfrost Butterfly Bush

"Blue Pacific" Juniper (Juniperus conferta 'Blue Pacific') is a ground-hugging evergreen shrub that belongs to the juniper family. Here are some key features of the Blue Pacific Juniper:

  1. Growth Habit: Blue Pacific Juniper has a prostrate or spreading growth habit. It forms a dense, low mat that can provide excellent ground cover.

  2. Foliage: The foliage of Blue Pacific Juniper is needle-like and has a silvery-blue to blue-green color, giving the plant its distinctive appearance. The leaves are arranged in dense clusters.

  3. Size: It typically grows to a height of about 6 to 12 inches, with a spreading habit that can cover a wide area, making it an effective ground cover.

  4. Sun Exposure: Blue Pacific Juniper prefers full sun but can tolerate partial shade. It tends to develop the best color in full sunlight.

  5. Soil Requirements: It thrives in well-drained soils and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.

  6. Salt Tolerance: Blue Pacific Juniper is known for its tolerance to coastal conditions, including salt spray, making it suitable for planting near the coast.

  7. Uses: This juniper cultivar is often used for ground cover in gardens, along slopes, or in areas where erosion control is needed. Its low, spreading habit makes it an excellent choice for landscape design.

  8. Hardiness: Blue Pacific Juniper is hardy in USDA zones 5 to 9, making it suitable for a range of climates.

When using Blue Pacific Juniper in your landscape, consider its specific growth habits and preferences. Proper spacing, well-draining soil, and adequate sunlight will help ensure its optimal performance. As with any plant, it's recommended to check with local nurseries or garden centers for advice tailored to your specific region and conditions.

"Blue Rug" is a common name for various juniper cultivars, particularly those that have a low, spreading growth habit and often exhibit a bluish or silvery-blue color in their foliage. These cultivars are popular for ground cover and landscaping due to their attractive appearance and hardiness. One well-known example is the "Blue Rug" juniper, which is often associated with Juniperus horizontalis.

Here are some key features of Juniperus horizontalis 'Blue Rug':

  1. Growth Habit: 'Blue Rug' is a low-growing, spreading juniper that typically forms a dense mat close to the ground. It can spread over a wide area, making it an excellent ground cover.

  2. Foliage: The foliage of 'Blue Rug' is often bluish or silvery-blue, giving it a distinctive and attractive appearance. The needle-like leaves are arranged in a scale-like pattern.

  3. Size: It has a prostrate growth habit, reaching a height of about 6 to 12 inches and spreading several feet horizontally.

  4. Hardiness: 'Blue Rug' is known for its hardiness and ability to tolerate a variety of soil conditions. It is also resistant to many pests and diseases.

  5. Sun Exposure: These junipers typically prefer full sun but can tolerate partial shade.

  6. Drought Tolerance: Once established, 'Blue Rug' juniper is drought-tolerant and requires minimal watering.

  7. Landscaping Use: Due to its low, spreading nature and attractive color, 'Blue Rug' is often used as ground cover in gardens, landscapes, and slopes. It can also be used to provide erosion control.

When using 'Blue Rug' juniper or any other juniper cultivar in your landscape, consider its specific needs and characteristics, such as soil conditions and sun exposure. As with any plant, it's recommended to check with local nurseries or garden centers for advice tailored to your specific region and conditions.

Elevate your garden with the ethereal beauty of the Lavender Chiffon Hibiscus. This exquisite variety, part of the Chiffon series, captivates with its delicate, frilly petals and enchanting lavender hue. Here's why the Lavender Chiffon Hibiscus is a must-have for any garden:

  1. Ethereal Elegance: The Lavender Chiffon Hibiscus enchants with its dreamy, chiffon-like petals that evoke a sense of whimsy and romance. Its soft lavender color adds a touch of serenity and sophistication to any landscape, creating a captivating focal point that draws the eye and captures the heart.

  2. Abundant Blooms: Prepare to be mesmerized by the Lavender Chiffon Hibiscus's prolific blooming habit. From late spring to early fall, this stunning shrub produces an abundance of large, showy flowers that adorn the garden with their graceful presence. Each bloom is a masterpiece of delicate beauty, showcasing the intricate layers of petals in exquisite detail.

  3. Continuous Blooming: Unlike traditional hibiscus varieties, the Lavender Chiffon Hibiscus blooms continuously throughout the growing season, providing months of uninterrupted floral display. Its long-lasting blooms bring joy and delight to the garden, ensuring that there is always something beautiful to behold.

  4. Compact Growth Habit: With its compact growth habit, the Lavender Chiffon Hibiscus is perfectly suited for gardens of all sizes. Whether planted as a standalone specimen, massed in groups, or incorporated into mixed borders, its tidy form and manageable size make it a versatile and adaptable addition to any landscape.

  5. Low Maintenance: Despite its stunning appearance, the Lavender Chiffon Hibiscus is surprisingly low maintenance. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, requiring minimal care to flourish. Regular watering and occasional fertilization are all that's needed to keep this beauty blooming all season long.

  6. Attracts Pollinators: The nectar-rich flowers of the Lavender Chiffon Hibiscus attract pollinators such as butterflies and bees to the garden, enhancing biodiversity and ecosystem health. Create a haven for these beneficial creatures while enjoying the beauty of this beloved garden favorite.

  7. Versatile Use: Whether used as a focal point in the garden, planted along borders, or incorporated into mixed plantings, the Lavender Chiffon Hibiscus adds instant elegance and charm to any setting. Its versatile nature allows it to be used in a variety of garden styles and designs, from formal to cottage gardens and everything in between.

  8. Endless Inspiration: Inspired by the delicate beauty of chiffon fabric, the Lavender Chiffon Hibiscus invites you to create a garden oasis that is as enchanting as it is elegant. Let its graceful presence inspire your creativity and imagination as you design a landscape that reflects your unique style and personality.

Experience the magic of the Lavender Chiffon Hibiscus and elevate your garden with its ethereal beauty and timeless charm. With its abundant blooms, continuous blooming habit, compact growth habit, and low maintenance requirements, it's no wonder why this stunning shrub is a favorite among gardeners. body_html:
Elevate your garden with the ethereal beauty of the Lavender Chiffon Hibiscus. This exquisite variety, part of the Chiffon series, captivates with its delicate, frilly petals and enchanting lavender hue. Here's why the Lavender Chiffon Hibiscus is a must-have for any garden:

  1. Ethereal Elegance: The Lavender Chiffon Hibiscus enchants with its dreamy, chiffon-like petals that evoke a sense of whimsy and romance. Its soft lavender color adds a touch of serenity and sophistication to any landscape, creating a captivating focal point that draws the eye and captures the heart.

  2. Abundant Blooms: Prepare to be mesmerized by the Lavender Chiffon Hibiscus's prolific blooming habit. From late spring to early fall, this stunning shrub produces an abundance of large, showy flowers that adorn the garden with their graceful presence. Each bloom is a masterpiece of delicate beauty, showcasing the intricate layers of petals in exquisite detail.

  3. Continuous Blooming: Unlike traditional hibiscus varieties, the Lavender Chiffon Hibiscus blooms continuously throughout the growing season, providing months of uninterrupted floral display. Its long-lasting blooms bring joy and delight to the garden, ensuring that there is always something beautiful to behold.

  4. Compact Growth Habit: With its compact growth habit, the Lavender Chiffon Hibiscus is perfectly suited for gardens of all sizes. Whether planted as a standalone specimen, massed in groups, or incorporated into mixed borders, its tidy form and manageable size make it a versatile and adaptable addition to any landscape.

  5. Low Maintenance: Despite its stunning appearance, the Lavender Chiffon Hibiscus is surprisingly low maintenance. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, requiring minimal care to flourish. Regular watering and occasional fertilization are all that's needed to keep this beauty blooming all season long.

  6. Attracts Pollinators: The nectar-rich flowers of the Lavender Chiffon Hibiscus attract pollinators such as butterflies and bees to the garden, enhancing biodiversity and ecosystem health. Create a haven for these beneficial creatures while enjoying the beauty of this beloved garden favorite.

  7. Versatile Use: Whether used as a focal point in the garden, planted along borders, or incorporated into mixed plantings, the Lavender Chiffon Hibiscus adds instant elegance and charm to any setting. Its versatile nature allows it to be used in a variety of garden styles and designs, from formal to cottage gardens and everything in between.

  8. Endless Inspiration: Inspired by the delicate beauty of chiffon fabric, the Lavender Chiffon Hibiscus invites you to create a garden oasis that is as enchanting as it is elegant. Let its graceful presence inspire your creativity and imagination as you design a landscape that reflects your unique style and personality.

Experience the magic of the Lavender Chiffon Hibiscus and elevate your garden with its ethereal beauty and timeless charm. With its abundant blooms, continuous blooming habit, compact growth habit, and low maintenance requirements, it's no wonder why this stunning shrub is a favorite among gardeners. Treat yourself to the beauty of the Lavender Chiffon Hibiscus and create a garden sanctuary that is truly enchanting.
title: Hibiscus Dark Lavender Chiffon

"Blue Rug" is a common name for various juniper cultivars, particularly those that have a low, spreading growth habit and often exhibit a bluish or silvery-blue color in their foliage. These cultivars are popular for ground cover and landscaping due to their attractive appearance and hardiness. One well-known example is the "Blue Rug" juniper, which is often associated with Juniperus horizontalis.

Here are some key features of Juniperus horizontalis 'Blue Rug':

  1. Growth Habit: 'Blue Rug' is a low-growing, spreading juniper that typically forms a dense mat close to the ground. It can spread over a wide area, making it an excellent ground cover.

  2. Foliage: The foliage of 'Blue Rug' is often bluish or silvery-blue, giving it a distinctive and attractive appearance. The needle-like leaves are arranged in a scale-like pattern.

  3. Size: It has a prostrate growth habit, reaching a height of about 6 to 12 inches and spreading several feet horizontally.

  4. Hardiness: 'Blue Rug' is known for its hardiness and ability to tolerate a variety of soil conditions. It is also resistant to many pests and diseases.

  5. Sun Exposure: These junipers typically prefer full sun but can tolerate partial shade.

  6. Drought Tolerance: Once established, 'Blue Rug' juniper is drought-tolerant and requires minimal watering.

  7. Landscaping Use: Due to its low, spreading nature and attractive color, 'Blue Rug' is often used as ground cover in gardens, landscapes, and slopes. It can also be used to provide erosion control.

When using 'Blue Rug' juniper or any other juniper cultivar in your landscape, consider its specific needs and characteristics, such as soil conditions and sun exposure. As with any plant, it's recommended to check with local nurseries or garden centers for advice tailored to your specific region and conditions.
title: Blue Rug Juniper

Product Description:

Add a burst of vibrant color and a touch of wild beauty to your garden with Bee Balm (Monarda didyma). Known for its striking, tubular flowers and aromatic foliage, Bee Balm is a favorite among gardeners and pollinators alike. This hardy perennial produces brilliant clusters of red, pink, or purple blooms, creating a stunning focal point in any landscape. Its fragrant leaves also make it a delightful addition to herb gardens and sensory plantings.

Features:

  • Vibrant Blooms: Produces clusters of striking, tubular flowers in shades of red, pink, or purple.
  • Attracts Pollinators: A favorite of bees, butterflies, and hummingbirds.
  • Fragrant Foliage: Aromatic leaves release a pleasant scent when brushed or crushed.
  • Long Blooming Season: Flowers from mid-summer to early fall, providing extended visual interest.
  • Versatile Growth: Suitable for garden beds, borders, cottage gardens, and herb gardens.
  • Medicinal Uses: Traditionally used in herbal remedies for its antiseptic and digestive properties.
  • Low Maintenance: Easy to grow and care for, with minimal pruning required.
  • Deer Resistant: Less likely to be browsed by deer, making it a reliable choice for many landscapes.
  • Spreads Easily: Forms dense clumps, which can be divided to propagate new plants.

Enhance your garden with the colorful and fragrant Bee Balm, a versatile and low-maintenance perennial that brings both beauty and biodiversity to your outdoor space.
title: Bee Balm 1 Gallon Assorted Colors

Bio-tone is a brand of plant fertilizer produced by Espoma, a company that specializes in organic gardening products. Bio-tone is specifically known for its line of biologically enhanced plant foods. The flagship product is Bio-tone Starter Plus, which is formulated to promote root development, reduce transplant shock, and encourage healthy growth in newly planted trees, shrubs, flowers, and vegetables.

Key features and components of Bio-tone Starter Plus include:

  1. Mycorrhizae: Bio-tone contains mycorrhizal fungi, which form a symbiotic relationship with plant roots. These beneficial fungi enhance nutrient uptake and improve the plant's ability to withstand environmental stress.

  2. Beneficial Bacteria: The fertilizer includes beneficial bacteria that aid in nutrient cycling and contribute to soil health. These bacteria enhance the breakdown of organic matter, making nutrients more available to plants.

  3. Bio-tone Microbes: The proprietary blend of microbes in Bio-tone includes a mix of beneficial fungi and bacteria that work synergistically to support plant growth and improve soil structure.

  4. Bio-tone Starter Plus: This specific product is often recommended for use when planting new plants, whether in containers or directly in the ground. It helps establish a strong root system and provides a nutrient-rich environment for young plants.

  5. Organic Ingredients: Bio-tone products are formulated with organic ingredients, making them suitable for organic gardening practices. They are often favored by gardeners who prioritize natural and sustainable gardening methods.

  6. Slow-Release Formula: Bio-tone Starter Plus is a slow-release fertilizer, meaning it provides a steady and continuous supply of nutrients to plants over an extended period. This slow-release feature helps prevent over-fertilization and minimizes the risk of nutrient runoff.

  7. Versatility: While Bio-tone Starter Plus is widely used for transplanting and establishing new plants, Espoma also offers other Bio-tone formulations for various purposes, such as flower tone, tomato tone, and plant tone, each tailored to the specific needs of different plants.

When using Bio-tone or any fertilizer, it's important to follow the manufacturer's recommended application rates and guidelines. Applying the fertilizer as directed ensures that plants receive the appropriate nutrients without the risk of over-fertilization. Always read and follow the product label for specific instructions on how to use Bio-tone or any other Espoma product.
title: Bio-Tone Starter Plus Starter Fertilizer

The "Emerald Green" Arborvitae (Thuja occidentalis 'Smaragd') is a popular cultivar of arborvitae known for its vibrant green foliage, dense growth habit, and columnar shape. Here are some key features of the Emerald Green Arborvitae:

  1. Foliage: The foliage of Emerald Green Arborvitae is a rich, emerald green color, maintaining its vibrancy throughout the year. The leaves are scale-like and pressed tightly against the branches.

  2. Growth Habit: This cultivar has a narrow, pyramidal or columnar growth habit. It naturally maintains a compact and upright shape without requiring extensive pruning.

  3. Size: Emerald Green Arborvitae typically reaches a height of 8 to 12 feet at maturity, with a width of about 3 to 4 feet.

  4. Versatility: Due to its narrow and compact form, Emerald Green Arborvitae is often used as a privacy screen, hedge, or as a specimen plant in landscaping. It can be planted in rows to create a dense and attractive living wall.

  5. Sunlight Requirements: It prefers full sun to partial shade for optimal growth and foliage color.

  6. Soil and Watering: The Emerald Green Arborvitae thrives in well-drained soil and benefits from regular watering, especially during dry periods. Proper watering is crucial for establishing the plant, but it becomes more drought-tolerant as it matures.

  7. Disease Resistance: This cultivar is known for its resistance to common arborvitae diseases, such as arborvitae leaf miner.

  8. Hardiness: Emerald Green Arborvitae is hardy in USDA zones 3 to 8, making it suitable for a wide range of climates.

When planting Emerald Green Arborvitae, consider its mature size and give it adequate spacing to allow for proper growth. Regular watering and occasional pruning to maintain its shape may be necessary. It is a popular choice for homeowners looking for an attractive and low-maintenance evergreen plant for privacy or landscaping purposes.
title: Emerald Green Arborvitae

body_html:
The Blue Star Juniper (Juniperus squamata 'Blue Star') is a popular and compact evergreen shrub known for its striking blue-green foliage. Here are some key features and care tips for the Blue Star Juniper:

  1. Foliage: The most distinctive feature of Blue Star Juniper is its dense, silvery-blue to blue-green needles. The foliage is scale-like and closely packed, giving the plant a unique texture and color.

  2. Size: Blue Star Juniper has a low, spreading growth habit and typically reaches a mature size of about 1 to 3 feet in height with a similar spread. Its compact and rounded form makes it an excellent choice for small gardens, rock gardens, or as a ground cover.

  3. Sunlight Requirements: This juniper thrives in full sun. Adequate sunlight exposure enhances the intensity of its blue color. It is well-suited for sunny locations and can tolerate a range of soil conditions.

  4. Soil and Watering: Blue Star Juniper prefers well-draining soil and is relatively drought-tolerant once established. Avoid waterlogged conditions, and let the soil dry out between waterings. Once established, it can withstand periods of dryness.

  5. Hardiness: Blue Star Juniper is a hardy plant and is well-suited for USDA hardiness zones 4 to 8. It can tolerate cold temperatures and is adaptable to different climates.

  6. Landscape Use: Due to its compact size and attractive blue foliage, Blue Star Juniper is often used in landscaping as a low border plant, in rock gardens, or as a specimen plant. It works well in both formal and informal garden settings.

  7. Low Maintenance: One of the advantages of Blue Star Juniper is its low-maintenance nature. It generally requires minimal pruning to maintain its shape. Pruning can be done in spring if necessary.

  8. Disease and Pest Resistance: Junipers, including Blue Star, are generally resistant to many common diseases and pests. However, good garden hygiene and proper care can help prevent potential issues.

  9. Year-Round Interest: Blue Star Juniper provides year-round interest with its vibrant blue foliage. The color remains consistent throughout the year, making it an attractive addition to the landscape.

When planting Blue Star Juniper, it's essential to consider its sunlight requirements and provide well-draining soil. As with any plant, local climate conditions should be taken into account for successful cultivation. Overall, the Blue Star Juniper is valued for its unique appearance, versatility, and ease of care in various garden settings.
title: Blue Star Juniper

Goshiki Osmanthus, scientifically known as Osmanthus heterophyllus 'Goshiki', is a cultivar of the evergreen shrub appreciated for its variegated foliage and fragrant flowers. Here are some key points about this plant:

  1. Appearance: Goshiki Osmanthus is characterized by its striking variegated foliage, which features a mix of colors including green, yellow, cream, and pink. The leaves are typically holly-like in shape, with serrated edges. The variegated foliage provides year-round interest to the landscape.

  2. Size: This osmanthus cultivar typically grows to a height of 3 to 4 feet with a similar spread, forming a dense, rounded shrub. Its compact size makes it suitable for various landscape applications, including as a specimen plant, hedge, or border planting.

  3. Fragrance: Like other osmanthus varieties, Goshiki Osmanthus produces highly fragrant flowers. The small, white flowers appear in clusters in late summer to early fall and emit a sweet, apricot-like fragrance that fills the air.

  4. Sun and Soil Requirements: Goshiki Osmanthus thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. It is tolerant of a range of soil types, including clay, loam, and sandy soils, but performs best in soil with good drainage.

  5. Watering: Once established, Goshiki Osmanthus is relatively drought-tolerant and only requires occasional watering during periods of prolonged dryness. However, regular watering is beneficial, especially during the plant's establishment period.

  6. Pruning: Pruning is generally minimal for Goshiki Osmanthus. It may be necessary to remove any dead, damaged, or diseased branches and to shape the plant to maintain its desired form. Pruning is best done after flowering to avoid removing flower buds.

  7. Landscape Use: Goshiki Osmanthus is commonly used as a specimen plant, hedge, or border planting in garden landscapes. Its variegated foliage, fragrant flowers, and compact size make it a versatile and attractive addition to garden settings.

Overall, Goshiki Osmanthus is a beautiful and low-maintenance shrub prized for its variegated foliage, fragrant flowers, and ease of care. Whether planted as a focal point in the garden or used to create a colorful hedge or border, it adds beauty and interest to garden landscapes throughout the year.
title: Goshiki Osmanthus

The Jubilation Gardenia, scientifically known as Gardenia jasminoides 'Leeone,' is a specific cultivar of the common gardenia. It is well-regarded for its fragrant white flowers, glossy evergreen foliage, and compact growth habit. Here are some key features and information about the Jubilation Gardenia:

  1. Flowers: One of the main attractions of Jubilation Gardenia is its beautiful, white, and highly fragrant flowers. The blooms are typically double or semi-double, creating an elegant appearance. The fragrance is often described as sweet and reminiscent of jasmine.

  2. Blooming Period: Jubilation Gardenia tends to bloom from late spring to early summer. The flowering season can extend into early fall in some regions.

  3. Foliage: The plant has glossy, dark green leaves that provide an attractive backdrop to the white flowers. The evergreen foliage adds visual interest to the garden throughout the year.

  4. Size: Jubilation is a relatively compact gardenia cultivar, usually reaching a mature height and width of around 3 to 4 feet (about 0.9 to 1.2 meters). This makes it suitable for various garden settings, including small gardens, borders, or container planting.

  5. Sun Requirements: Like most gardenias, Jubilation prefers to be planted in partial to full sun. However, in hotter climates, some afternoon shade can be beneficial to protect the plant from intense sunlight.

  6. Soil and Watering: Gardenias thrive in well-draining, acidic soil. They appreciate consistent moisture, especially during dry periods. Applying a layer of mulch around the base of the plant can help retain soil moisture.

  7. Hardiness: Jubilation Gardenia is generally hardy in USDA Hardiness Zones 7 to 10. It may require winter protection in colder climates.

  8. Use in Landscaping: Jubilation is often used as a specimen plant, in mass plantings, or as part of foundation plantings. Its compact size and fragrant flowers make it a versatile choice for various garden designs.

  9. Pruning: Regular pruning is not always necessary, but if needed, it's best done after the flowering period. This helps shape the plant and encourage bushier growth.

  10. Fragrance: The sweet fragrance of the flowers makes Jubilation Gardenia a delightful addition to gardens, patios, or near entryways where the scent can be appreciated.

When cultivating Jubilation Gardenia, it's important to provide the right growing conditions, including well-draining soil, proper sunlight, and regular watering. Additionally, gardenias can benefit from fertilization with an acidic plant fertilizer to support healthy growth and flowering.
title: Jubilation Gardenia

Espoma Plant-tone is an organic, all-purpose fertilizer suitable for use on a wide variety of plants, including flowers, vegetables, trees, shrubs, and indoor plants. Produced by the Espoma Company, known for their organic gardening products, Plant-tone is formulated to provide essential nutrients for healthy growth and vibrant blooms. Here are some key features and tips regarding Espoma Plant-tone fertilizer:

  1. Nutrient Composition: Espoma Plant-tone is made from natural ingredients, including poultry manure, bone meal, alfalfa meal, greensand, sulfate of potash, and other organic materials. These ingredients provide a balanced blend of essential nutrients, including nitrogen (N), phosphorus (P), potassium (K), calcium (Ca), magnesium (Mg), sulfur (S), and micronutrients, necessary for healthy plant growth and development.

  2. NPK Ratio: Plant-tone typically has a balanced NPK (nitrogen-phosphorus-potassium) ratio, such as 5-3-3 or 5-3-4, which is suitable for a wide range of plants. The balanced formulation promotes strong root development, lush foliage, and vibrant blooms.

  3. Slow-Release Formula: Espoma Plant-tone is formulated as a slow-release fertilizer, meaning that the nutrients are gradually released into the soil over time. This slow-release mechanism provides a steady and consistent supply of nutrients to the plants, reducing the risk of nutrient leaching and ensuring long-lasting benefits.

  4. Organic and OMRI Listed: Plant-tone is classified as an organic fertilizer and is approved for use in organic gardening practices. It is listed by the Organic Materials Review Institute (OMRI), indicating that it meets the strict standards for organic certification and is free from synthetic chemicals, pesticides, and genetically modified organisms (GMOs).

  5. Application: Espoma Plant-tone can be applied to the soil around the base of plants, following the manufacturer's instructions for dosage and frequency. It can be used as a starter fertilizer at planting time and as a supplemental feed throughout the growing season to promote healthy growth and flowering.

  6. Watering: After applying Espoma Plant-tone, it's essential to water the plants thoroughly to help activate the fertilizer and ensure proper nutrient uptake by the roots. Adequate moisture is crucial for maximizing the effectiveness of the fertilizer and promoting healthy plant growth.

  7. Storage: Plant-tone should be stored in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight and moisture to maintain its potency and shelf life. Proper storage helps prevent clumping and preserves the quality of the fertilizer for future use.

Espoma Plant-tone is a versatile and reliable fertilizer suitable for both indoor and outdoor plants. When used as directed and in conjunction with proper cultural practices, Plant-tone can help promote vigorous growth, lush foliage, and abundant blooms, contributing to the overall health and beauty of the garden.
title: Plant-Tone Organic Fertilizer

The Murray Cypress, scientifically known as Cupressocyparis leylandii 'Murray', is a cultivar of the Leyland Cypress. Leyland Cypress is a hybrid tree created by crossing the Monterey cypress (Cupressus macrocarpa) and the Alaskan cedar (Callitropsis nootkatensis). The Murray Cypress, like the Leyland Cypress in general, is commonly used as a fast-growing evergreen tree in landscaping and for creating privacy screens or windbreaks. Here are some key features and information about the Murray Cypress:

  1. Growth: Murray Cypress is known for its rapid growth, making it an excellent choice for quickly establishing a dense green barrier.

  2. Foliage: The foliage consists of flattened sprays of small, scale-like leaves that have a green to blue-green color. The foliage is typically dense and provides good year-round screening.

  3. Form: The tree has a columnar to pyramidal shape, with a fairly uniform and symmetrical appearance.

  4. Size: The mature size of the Murray Cypress can vary, but it often reaches heights of 30 to 50 feet with a width of around 8 to 10 feet.

  5. Adaptability: Murray Cypress is adaptable to various soil types and is generally hardy. It prefers full sun but can tolerate partial shade.

  6. Uses: Common uses for Murray Cypress include privacy screens, windbreaks, and as a decorative tree in larger landscapes. It's often used in residential and commercial settings for its rapid growth and year-round screening capabilities.

  7. Maintenance: Regular pruning can help maintain a more compact form and encourage denser growth. It's essential to provide adequate spacing when planting, considering the mature size of the tree.

  8. Disease Resistance: While the Leyland Cypress, in general, is susceptible to certain diseases like root rot and canker, the Murray Cypress has improved disease resistance compared to some other cultivars.
title: Murray Cypress

body_html:
Give your garden a colorful spin with Apple Twist Coral Bells, or ‘Apple Twist’ Heuchera. Here’s why Heuchera is the perfect addition to your garden:

Appearance: ‘Apple Twist’ Heuchera features colorful foliage that changes with the seasons. Leaves emerge yellow with red veining, and later transition to apple green. Cream flowers bloom mid-summer. The leaves are deeply lobed and have a ruffled or scalloped edge, adding texture to the plant. 

Size: This variety typically forms a compact mound of foliage, reaching a height of 6-12 inches with a spread of 18-24 inches. It is well-suited for use as a ground cover, edging plant, or in containers.

Blooming Season: Apple Twist Coral Bells produce delicate, cream colored flowers on slender stems in summer. While the flowers are not the main feature of this plant, they add a charming accent to the colorful foliage. Bees, butterflies, and hummingbirds are attracted to the sprightly blooms. 

Sun and Soil Requirements: These plants prefer partial shade to full shade. Average watering is required and they prefer well-draining soil. They are adaptable to various soil types and environmental conditions. This variety of Heuchera can thrive in zones 4-9.

Maintenance: Apple Twist Coral Bells are relatively low-maintenance plants. Deadheading spent flowers can help maintain a tidy appearance, although it is not necessary for the health of the plant. Remove any damaged or discolored foliage as needed to encourage new growth.

Landscape Use: This variety is a wonderfully compact, versatile plant that adds color and texture to shaded garden areas. They are often used as edging plants along paths or borders, as ground covers beneath trees or shrubs, or in containers on patios or balconies.

Overall, Apple Twist Coral Bells are valued for their colorful foliage, compact habit, and adaptability to shaded conditions. They provide year-round interest in the garden and pair well with other shade-loving plants in mixed plantings.
title: Heuchera Apple Twist 1g
